data.title: MSBA Class of 2023
data.text:
Aarushee graduated from UC Irvine in June 2022 with a Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering and a Minor in Business. Currently, she is a Master of Science in Business Analytics student at UCLA Anderson School of Management, with an Anderson Merit Fellowship.

During her fourth-year business classes, she came across courses like New Product Development and Management and Database Management. These exposed her to concepts such as A/B Testing, Hierarchical Clustering, and, Hypothesis Testing. Additionally, she worked on data analytics projects using Python that improved her knowledge of the role statistics and quantitative analysis play in financial case studies. With all these exposures, she developed a strong interest in problem-solving and realized how she can use her background as an engineer and move forward in her journey to synergize the worlds of Technology and Business!

She’s currently taking a course on Machine Learning for Decision Making and is looking forward to learning how to use machine-learning algorithms to learn from data, identify patterns and make decisions with minimal human intervention!

Aarushee is also an innovator and received her patent from the Indian Government at 13 for a prototype in tetra-pak. The prototype can disburse clean water for administering Oral Rehydration Salts (ORS) for kids suffering from diarrhea, especially in countries where clean drinking water is scarce and a must for ORS administration. The inspiration behind her design comes from research she conducted for her school project, catching her attention that Diarrheal disease is the second leading cause of death amongst children under the age of 5.

With the same commitment and love for giving back to the community that helped her be what she is today, she is passionate about utilizing the skills gained from this program and building more such innovations soon to address issues of society that have been ignored or received

Abhi Akkaraju is currently pursuing a Master of Science in Business Analytics at the UCLA Anderson School of Business. He was born and raised in the San Francisco Bay Area and then attended the Ohio State University for a bachelor's degree in Management Information Systems with a minor in Business Analytics. This gave him a diversified background with analytics, business acumen, and technical skills.

After graduating from OSU in 2019, Abhi gained 3 years of experience working as a Data Scientist at Cisco Systems in the field of Sales AI. This helped him develop cross functional skills within the areas of data science, product management, and sales analytics while building technical knowledge using tools such as Python, SQL, Tableau, Google Cloud Platform, and more.

Abhi’s goal through the MSBA program is to gain domain expertise across different industries that utilize analytics including healthcare, entertainment, and sports. He aims to master the skill of translating the output of analytics into actionable and successful business plans. Abhi is pursuing Product Management roles within analytics. In his free time, Abhi loves playing basketball, tennis, and volleyball and closely follows these sports with an analytical perspective. He also enjoys cooking, video games, and traveling.

Abinash is commonly known as Panda amongst everyone as his last name is ‘Panda’. He graduated from VIT, Vellore with a Bachelor’s in Electronics and Communication Engineering in 2020. During his time at VIT, he experienced an academically enriching journey, under the tutelage of revered faculty members and industry stalwarts. Further, he participated in several events and activities organized by the clubs on campus, which helped him gain critical interpersonal skills. He also interned at Siemens, where he worked on Home Automation using cloud services and built a Geographical model of their equipment located worldwide using Excel and Macros. Besides his interest in technology, he also took time for activities such as writing blogs and organizing voluntary boot camps, and educational drives in rural areas that helped him process his emotions better and positively impact society.

He strived to gain professional experiences shaping his understanding of technologies in a real-world environment. During his internship and subsequent employment at Deloitte USI, he worked on Financial Data Analysis, which included Data Wrangling and Visualization. It was a positive experience working on real-time projects with significant ramifications, helping him deliver a substantial impact. He strived to gain the most nuanced knowledge, leading him to earn specialized certification in technologies such as Tableau. He was an active member of the CSR community of Deloitte and has volunteered for several activities during Impact Day, every year on thanksgiving which involves interacting with non-privileged children.

Panda is very excited to be here at UCLA Anderson, sharing the cohort among the brightest minds worldwide. His experience so far has been joyous, and his presence has been greeted with alacrity throughout the campus. He is looking forward to opportunities to learn and implement his learnings soon in real-world scenarios.

Khue aspires to leverage analytics to lead digital transformation, optimize operations and deliver affordable and high-quality products/services to customers, particularly in healthcare, consulting, technology, supply chain industries and entrepreneurship. Master of Science in Business Analytics at UCLA Anderson School of Management has empowered her with technical skills, industry knowledge and valuable connections with professionals who inspire her to grow professionally and personally.

Khue has over three years of experience spearheading the Business Analytics department at Hakko Products, introducing new analytics approaches to business functions, mentoring talents and providing data-driven strategies to the C-suite. With her leadership, her team successfully revamped the data management system, created and educated users with data visualization tools, automated business processes and originated data models to answer business questions. Apart from business analytics, she also collaborated with internal and external stakeholders to develop an integrated CRM – ERP system from inception to implementation, launched a new company in Vietnam and led 15 salespeople to increase sales of chemical products in the ASEAN market.

Prior to her career in analytics, Khue was a biomedical engineer intern at BD and NephTech. Most significant projects include developing a prototype of a safety component for the Odon device (an assisted vaginal delivery equipment) at BD and originating sensor array configuration to detect narrow blood vessels in patients with kidney disease at the healthcare start-up NephTech. Working in a start-up environment allowed her to further explore the business aspect of the healthcare industry and thus played a pivotal role in her career development and pursuit of entrepreneurship.

Apart from professional and academic commitment, Khue enjoys painting, playing musical instruments and watching documentaries. She is a travel enthusiast who loves to meet new people and experience new cultures from all continents around the world.

Ashish graduated from the Indian Institute of Technology Madras ( IIT Madras) with a Master's and Bachelor's degree in Naval Architecture and Ocean Engineering and a minor in Systems Engineering in July 2022. He was among the few selected exchange students at Instituto Superior Técnico in Lisbon, Portugal.

Ashish is a philomath with a genuine love for learning. He held several leadership positions in various student clubs throughout his studies at IIT Madras. His inquisitive nature helped him expand his skillset in Python, SQL, and Machine Learning techniques through internships and projects. He was also the Sri Poovai TR Srinivasan & S Alamelu Awardee and the Samsung- IITM Pravartak Undergraduate Fellowship recipient for his academic excellence.

These diverse experiences equipped Ashish to tackle real-world analytical challenges. The task of adding a business perspective to analytical problems by giving them a real-world touch drove him to business analytics. So here he is, pursuing his Master's in Business Analytics as an Anderson merit fellowship recipient. He is delighted to use his new skills from the MSBA program to broaden his business acumen and analyze industry problems with the appropriate tools to translate data into actionable insights.

Besides working on fascinating projects and acquiring skills, Ashish has always had a great interest in media and entertainment. This passion led him to gain knowledge in the media and entertainment sector and made him one of the 17 representatives of IIT Madras in the Filmmaking/Photography competitions at Inter IIT Cultural Meet. He is also a paparazzo and a successful YouTube content creator with over 11.7K+ subscribers, engaging 2.6+ Million views. In addition, he enjoys traveling and has visited 12 European nations, where he fostered multiculturalism and enhanced his ability to adapt to different circumstances.

Bingcheng just graduated from UC Santa Barbara, as Financial mathematics and statistics major. Currently, he is a Master of Science in Business Analytics student at UCLA Anderson School of Management, with an Anderson Merit Fellowship. He is able to combine data analysis knowledge with his financial skills to glean more real-life insights from data. He worked as an intern for Shanghai Securities company and constructed a product framework by analyzing aggregated client risk tolerance and product preferences, making investment recommendations that increased client revenue by 6% based on recommended products.

He also has experience in several data analysis projects or competitions, such as Amazon Hackson, Humana Healthcare Analytics, and COVID-19 monte-Carlo project. He solves problems related to demand forecasting, natural language processing, marketing analytics, and operational analytics using tools such as Python, R, and SQL.

He has a great passion for working for non-profit organizations because he feels it can make a lot of difference for the many people in need in this society. He used to work for one of the Chinese national Poverty-Relief programs and cooperate with the Chinese Academy of Sciences. He established a linear regression model in R language, using the monthly sale and yield respectively as x and y values to explore their interrelationship. The gap between the two linear lines of post-and pro-marketing indicated that my marketing strategy could bring lasting sales growth.

He looks forward to using the data analysis and machine learning knowledge he learned in MSBA in his future job.

Bofang Yao received his dual Bachelor’s degree in Economics and International Business from the University of California San Diego in 2022 with a specialization in finance. During his undergraduate education, Bofang worked as an intern for a Merger and Acquisition firm and also directed UCSD’s $1M endowment fund as the portfolio manager. Based on these experiences, Bofang discovered his passion for applying quantitative analytical skills in a business context and noticed how rapidly industries were chaging through the influence of data analytics.

After realizing how essential it is for businesses to effectively make decisions based on data, Bofang decided to join the UCLA Master of Science in Business Analytics program. In the program, Bofang learned important technical skills in SQL and machine learning. The program also helped him to better combine analytics skills with communication. In addition to the course curriculum, Bofang has greatly benefited from his extraordinary peers who constantly encourage and inspire him to strive.

When Bofang is not busy with coding, he enjoys video games, music, and good books.

Calin graduated from Bocconi University in Milan, Italy with a Bachelor’s of Science in International Economics and Management. During this time, he understood that the analytical side of the business sphere is the area he is passionate about, as he excelled in courses such as Statistics, Microeconomics, and Data Analytics. As such, he decided to pursue his Master’s of Science in Business Analytics at UCLA Anderson and continue his development of these skills.

Another instance that solidified a Business Analytics career as the right one for him was his time as a Junior Project Manager at one of the biggest pharmacy chains in his home country. Although fresh from his undergraduate studies, he was able to bridge the gap between the business-oriented and the technology-oriented members of his team by understanding the way data and insights should be presented and visualized for each. Furthermore, he took the lead on multiple data and analytically-inclined projects, such as pricing the entire offering of the company for their new e-commerce platform.

Calin has also worked for companies such as Coface, PriceWaterhouseCoopers, and Raiffeisen Bank which helped with building his holistic view of the business world. These diverse experiences and his enthusiasm towards numbers, data, but also collaboration, make him a technical and capable team-player. Speaking of teams, Calin is also a big fan of sports, his favorite being Formula 1.

Celine is an enthusiastic, curious data scientist who appreciates the role of data in decision making and strives to continuously provide business acumen with strong technical skills. She graduated from Emory University with a double major in Quantitative Sciences with Psychology concentration and Film and Media Studies. During her time at Emory, Celine learned to master various data analysis and visualization tools, including Python, R, MySQL, and Tableau, and honed her skill sets through internships at KPMG and Comcast. She has found a genuine interest in the media and entertainment industry and is eager to contribute as the industry has continued to refine its data transformation in recent years.

Outside of schools, Celine has been actively involved in entertainment analysis for more than two years. In 2020, She co-founded the media channel "Intermix" specializing in producing K-pop dance remakes, which achieved over 600,000 views and received over 30,000 likes in one year. In 2021, She joined the podcast "Learn or Be Learned" as a part-time digital media analyst and successfully raised the channel to the top 5% globally in nine months. As a data practitioner, she has always been consciously exploring a more effective and authentic way to connect data to both explicit and inexplicit customer needs.

While working as the Customer Operations Intern at Comcast, Celine learned to transform raw datasets on Teradata into presentable business reports on Tableau using MySQL and led the standardization of data collection procedures for the CX team. Her work has significantly helped the team to not only extract cloud data more efficiently, but also understand customer needs and call center agent performance more proactively.

Moving forward, Celine is excited to be a part of the MSBA Class of 2023. She looks forward to developing expertise in utilizing real-world datasets to generate successful business strategies that meet and exceed customer needs and expectations.

Adia Yao is a passionate Data Scientist and an MS Business Analytics candidate at UCLA Anderson. She finished her undergraduate study at New York University with concentrations in Data Science and Fashion Business. Upon graduation, she worked as a Data Analyst at PwC in the Bay Area. She utilized her solid analytical skills (Python, SQL, Tableau, etc.) to build sophisticated recalculation models and ensured data pipeline efficiency and accuracy. Many of her clients are big-name tech firms in Silicon Valley. By working in close collaboration to solve business problems, she expedited project hours by 25% and gained high recognition from the team.

Being highly motivated, she continues to sharpen her programming skills and product sense through the MSBA program at UCLA. She found the statistics class to be very helpful and with its solid foundation, she now has smoothly transitioned into the Machine Learning class, learning about the theories and applications behind various models and packages.

Despite her passion for analytics, she enjoys trying and learning new things. Having a diverse and multidisciplinary background, she has a unique understanding of the retail space, social media, as well as technology industry.

Eric is a student and Anderson Merit Fellow in the Master of Science in Business Analytics (MSBA) program at UCLA Anderson School of Management. He has particular interest and experience in the industry areas of sports, entertainment, technology/software, and social good.

Born and raised in the San Francisco Bay Area, Eric obtained his bachelor’s degree in statistics from Cal Poly San Luis Obispo. In addition, prior to the MSBA program, Eric worked in sports in various roles: at the college NCAA Division 1 level for basketball as a student manager and analytics staffer for both Cal Poly men’s/women’s basketball and UCLA women’s basketball; at Sports Reference (Basketball-Reference, FBref), a prominent sports data provider; and at the Atlanta Hawks of the NBA. He has also worked, volunteered, and performed research in cybersecurity, mental health and homeless outreach services, and data ethics.

At UCLA MSBA, Eric is enjoying classes in data management and machine learning, with goals and aspirations of applying a blend of technical skills from the classroom and soft skills such as his leadership and teamwork abilities towards future roles in analytics and data science both in the summer of 2023 and upon graduation. In his spare time when not watching sports, Eric enjoys sunny days at the beach, exploring and cooking new dishes, and playing board games.

Erika graduated from Carleton College with a B.A in Statistics in June 2021. Her undergraduate coursework gave her a solid foundation in Statistics and Data Science, and she was able to put this knowledge into practice by conducting a research project on network analysis of Twitter users during her senior year. In addition to Statistics, her interest in consumer behaviors/markets drew her to pursue a variety of classes in Economics such as Behavioral Economics and Game Theory. Outside of her coursework, Erika worked as an R tutor and a statistics course grader for the Department of Statistics and participated in many extracurricular activities. During her undergraduate studies, Erika completed two internships, both of which were related to digital advertising, namely as a YouTube Ads Marketing Intern at Google and a Web Marketing Intern at a startup in Tokyo, Japan.

Before joining MSBA, Erika worked at Rakuten for 9 months as a part-time Digital Ad Operations Assistant and as a full-time Customer Support Analyst Trainee, where she was responsible for digital ad management as well as call center operations.

Currently, Erika is a first-year student in the MS in Business Analytics program at UCLA Anderson School of Management. The program has not only helped her advance her programming skills to the next level, but also honed her ability to translate technical insights into easy to understand stories and actionable insights

Erika is currently looking for data analytics internships in Tech/Entertainment/Retail/CPG industries for the summer of 2023.

Esther is an enthusiastic data analyst with a solid analytical mindset and academic background. She graduated from Sogang University in Seoul, Korea with a double bachelor’s degree in Economics and Data Analytics. She developed her technical and professional skills by participating in numerous extracurricular activities. She collaborated with the Department of Economics as a research assistant where she applied her coding skills (Python, SQL) and computational methodologies (NLP, KMeans Clustering, PCA, Regression Modeling) in real-world studies. She has also worked as a teaching assistant for an advanced Python class, where she led weekly tutoring sessions and helped students successfully complete analytics projects with hygienic and efficient code.

During her years as an undergraduate, Esther gained a wide range of industry knowledge and business insights outside the classroom as well. She worked as an intern at the New York branch of Statista, a company offering market and consumer data through an online platform. She was responsible for promoting and recommending Statista's data to the Canadian offices of global companies. The experience taught her that data plays a key role in today's businesses. Prior to joining UCLA MSBA, she joined Korea Credit Data (KCD) as a data analyst Intern, where she constructed a pipeline to analyze front-end mobile app data and built a team data dashboard based on KPIs by tracking usage rates of 500K+ workplace users in Korea. She provided comprehensive data-driven solutions to mobile app-based financial software services, which resulted in a 300% increase in PV (Page Views) within a month after she joined the team.

Learning about new kinds of business structures and how their purposes are built to the point of seeking profit is of particular interest to her. She has a strong desire to leverage this curiosity with her strong technical skills and business acumen to make an impact throughout her career.

Apart from her academics and professional experience, Esther was a leader and conductor of an amateur symphony orchestra containing 50 players. She has been playing violin and piano for 20 years, and she also enjoys playing golf in her free time.

Eumin is a highly motivated data analyst with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. She is interested in making a business impact by sharing social values as well as helping companies solve strategic problems. In order to contribute to making a better world, she wishes to build products that can help people create their own meaningful and fulfilling experiences.

Eumin graduated from Yonsei University in Seoul, Korea, with a bachelor’s degree in Economics. Her undergraduate coursework helped her gain knowledge in diverse fields and build a solid technical foundation. She took part in lots of project-based experiences where she applied various data science methodologies with Python, R, and SQL to derive actionable insights from large datasets. Outside of the class, she participated in the Entrepreneur Startup Club and an overseas exchange program, which helped broaden her perspectives.

Prior to joining UCLA MSBA program, Eumin gained some data analytics experience during her professional journey at Ernst & Young (EY). As a technology consultant, she predicted market trends by analyzing sales data and established online sales business process. She acquired data collection, integration, and manipulation skills through hands-on experiences in business settings. Apart from technical skills, she also leveraged her communication skills, which are needed to clearly share data-driven outcomes and collaborate with other teams.

Now in the MSBA program, Eumin is extremely excited to fully develop her analytical skills and business acumen to apply to real-world scenarios. With her enthusiasm and passion for data analytics, she is looking forward to applying the knowledge she has gained in the program to help organizations solve strategic problems and boost their businesses.

Grace earned her Bachelor of Commerce degree from the University of British Columbia with a major in Finance and concentration in Business Analytics. In her business analytics classes, she used tools like R, SQL, and Python to analyze real-world data in a business context and discovered how analytics are transforming virtually any industry. She learned how analytics could help businesses make more informed decisions and advise business strategies, which fascinated her and sparked her interest in the intersection of business and analytics. This led her to apply to the UCLA Master of Science in Business Analytics program to continue honing her technical skills in data analytics from one of the best business analytics programs in the world and gain access to the wide variety of resources available in the program.

Since starting her MSBA program at UCLA Anderson, Grace has continued to be inspired by the diligence and inquisitiveness of her peers as well as the vast amount of opportunities available to students in the program. She is excited to apply what she has learned in the program to her future roles upon completion of the program and help answer tough business questions with the use of data.

Felix graduated from the University of British Columbia in 2022 with a Bachelor’s degree in Economics. During his undergraduate studies, he actively engaged in courses relating to intermediate macro and microeconomics analysis, international trade and finance, along with quantitative economic modeling with data science applications. His knowledge in the field of economics aligned with his interest in computer science, wherein he later developed programming skills in Python, R, and SQL.

Prior to joining UCLA Anderson, Felix spent several years as an entrepreneur where he took part in co-founding a Bubble Tea shop in Vancouver, acting as a business consultant where he made his first data analysis attempt by applying the K-nearest neighbors algorithm to forecast customer preferences. He later invested in Look-4-Tutor, a company that specializes in providing students with study programs that are suitable to their educational needs. Felix then took an internship at LivingSpace Interiors as E-commerce & marketing Analyst where he self-defined the customer wealth matrix. It is through this experience that he developed predictive models and discovered insights into the company’s data.

Felix also aided Hong Kong Polytechnic University in designing research to test the goal-gradient effects on the demand side of the sharing economy. He went on to create an experiment in Difference in Difference regression to car ride-sharing application data, which helped resolve the limitation of sample size and drivers’ personality variance. Joining the Master of Science of Business Analytics (MSBA) program at UCLA Anderson will allow him to realize his passion for analytics and data-driven business process and development.

Outside of his professional and academic career, on his off times, Felix enjoys making hip-hop songs, and he has signed a publishing company that helps deliver his music on multiple platforms.

Hannah is a highly motivated data analyst who has a sound foundation in finance and focuses on resolving business problems from data perspectives. Hannah graduated from the University of Southern California with a bachelor’s degree in Accounting. During her time as an undergraduate student, Hannah was a business student leader in multiple student organizations. After graduating, she pursued a career in the accounting industry at Ernst & Young and found her passion in data while implementing traditional processes with analytical methods.

Hannah has strong interests in technology, finance, and entertainment industries. She also has experience in Python, SQL, and R. Both of her technical skills and interpersonal skills have shaped her into a good data storyteller. The MSBA program at UCLA Anderson has further enhanced her skill sets and allowed her to apply them to real life situations. By participating in the Amazon Datathon, she not only gained more hands-on experience but also gained new insights from the industry.

As she continues to progress through the MSBA program, she will focus on becoming a successful business data analyst by learning from her professors, cohort peers, and industry professionals. She is beyond excited to start a journey in leveraging her knowledge and skills to help companies make business decisions with data analytics.

Sherman graduated from the University of Hong Kong (HKU) with a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting and Finance. After graduation, Sherman joined Hang Seng Bank (a subsidiary bank of HSBC Group) as a Management Trainee in the Wealth and Personal Banking field. He held a variety of roles during traineeship including mortgage market analysis, structural investment product development, and fintech projects management. He was then promoted to Product Manager supervising innovation strategy and product development in Hang Seng’s retail distribution division.

Having worked in Hang Seng for 4 years, Sherman has led a team of 100+ Digital Advocates to promote various digital banking products across the Bank’s branch network, achieving +60% annual growth in the product signup. Sherman was also a product manager of a new “mobile-in-branch” hybrid model in the Bank’s digital account opening service, which saved $0.75M annually of manual KYC operational overhead.

During his time in Hang Seng, he developed increasing interests towards data analytics and product management. Sherman is excited to embark on an academic advancement to expand his knowledge integrating quantitative analysis in real-world business contexts; thus, he chose to join the MSBA program at UCLA Anderson School of Management.

At UCLA MSBA, he is particularly interested in prescriptive models, product analytics, and machine learning. Leveraging his business background and product management experience, Sherman aspires to become a well-rounded innovation strategist with advanced technical skillsets on quantitative analytics acquired during the MSBA program. He is looking forward to gaining more industrial insights through his academic journey at Anderson, especially in the Fintech, SaaS, and healthcare fields.

Apart from academics and workplaces, Sherman is an active member in the Hongkonger’s community in LA dedicated to promoting Cantonese education in the expat group. He has also participated in the academic research of Hongkonger’s identity and Cantonese-English Bilingual studies in UC Irvine’s BMB laboratory.

Hyunduk (Doug) is an aspiring Data Scientist with four years of experience in product management/ data analytics.

It's D-day - Doug and his team release a new feature for their search engine, the wiki search. As he sees the daily average user of the wikis surpass the target number, he feels the adrenaline rushing through his veins. These priceless moments taught him the excitement of discovering customers' demands through data.

Before joining MSBA, Doug had four years of product management/data analytics experience in Samsung Electronics, where he designed and led the development of various products, such as the integrated search engine, cloud platform, and the IT service management platform. Leveraging his solid technical skills in Python, SQL, and IT infrastructure, he derived insights from a large stream of data ranging from customer logs to documents and geographical data. As a result, his products now serve 20K+ customers, leading to millions of dollars of cost savings each year.

After graduating from Korea University with a Bachelor of Science in industrial engineering, Doug has a particular interest and experience in the technology/software and retail industry. With the product sense acquired as a product manager and the analytical capabilities he hones throughout MSBA, he's looking for an opportunity to impact not 20K but 20M customers in the future.

Ipek graduated from the University of California, San Diego with a B.S. in Cognitive Science. During her time there, Ipek discovered that machine learning and neural computation components of the field of cognitive science piqued her interest the most. Adapting her interdisciplinary knowledge, Ipek engaged in academic research to understand the connections between the mind, the world, and languages. Outside of her studies, Ipek actively took part in student organizations, and she held leadership and volunteer positions where she aimed to develop social impact awareness in healthcare, education, and technology by using her analytics, collaboration, and organizational skills.

During her undergraduate studies, Ipek gained extensive experience in both academics and internships. She has worked on various projects focused on data-driven solutions to increase customer experience and social responsibility to business problems gaining hands-on experience not only in data science and machine learning, but marketing, product management, user experience, and leadership. In her role as a Marketing Analytics Intern at Salesforce, Ipek was convinced that business analytics was significant in helping companies build better products and address consumer needs consciously where she positively drove engagement and sales by remodeling complicated data, evaluating consumer shopping behavior, and developing business acumen.

As a part of the MSBA Class of 2023, Ipek is grateful for the opportunity to continue her quantitative as well as business education at UCLA Anderson. Ipek is eager to learn more from the expert faculty about business analytics and data-driven strategies so she may make better business decisions. Ipek enjoys learning Python, R, and SQL, and has found the Machine Learning for Decision Making, and Customer Analytics courses particularly exciting, and looks forward to using her newly acquired skills in analytics and product management positions after graduation. In her spare time, Ipek enjoys sailing, learning new languages, and exploring film, photography, and media arts.

Irene is currently pursuing her Master's in Business Analytics at UCLA Anderson School of Management. She graduated with distinction from UC Santa Barbara in 2021 with a Bachelor of Science degree in Financial Mathematics and Statistics.

She attained a sound grasp of advanced mathematical and statistical theories during her undergraduate studies. As one of the top 20% applicants selected, she embarked on a project to study the two classical algorithms, Newton-Raphson and Brent's Approaches, and develop a Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) model for forecasting stock price on close based on time series data. She further developed her knowledge in the derivatives market and honed her skills in Python, R, SQL, and SAS through her internships

Upon graduation, she joined Black Knight as a financial engineering consultant to optimize risk prediction models for mortgage-backed securities. She also utilized her analytical and modeling skills to build a customized non-QM model for her client and provided recommendations on modeling strategies. Through her interaction with the Client Support and Development Team, she learned how to work cross-functionally within an organization.

Having oriented her academic and professional preparations toward business analytics, she envisions herself applying the Machine Learning and Data Storytelling skills she acquires from MSBA to help organizations achieve effective decision-making.

Isha comes from a background in business and engineering, with experience across multiple analytics domains. Her interest in data analytics stems from her work in her previous role as Data Analyst with one of the largest global marketing and advertising agency networks.

With an undergraduate degree in Computer Science Engineering from IGDTUW, Delhi, a premier engineering school in India, she worked as a Developer intern at Cisco ThingQbator on a build from scratch product development project. This project experience gave her the understanding of how data management and product structuring works and how critical it is to realize the responsibility of the data accuracy for optimization solutions.

Strengthened by a background in Merkle, Dentsu’s analytics practice with leading Automobiles, Pharmaceuticals and Consumer Retail clients, Isha is skilled in 5+ leading Business Intelligence platforms, Python, SQL, statistics, machine learning, besides strong understanding of customer behavior, sales and marketing tools and product analytics. Isha works best in fast-paced, demanding, and collaborative environments, which require a hands-on and data-driven approach to solving the most intricate corporate problems.

Isha joined the Business Analytics program at UCLA Anderson to build up business acumen and round out her analytics training in a truly interdisciplinary setting. Isha is excited to combine her background in descriptive analytics with exciting techniques in machine learning and neural networks to help data-driven predictions and optimizations to customize user experience through analytics.

Ivan Yang graduated from Wesleyan University with a B.A. in Economics and Philosophy, and a Minor in Data Analysis. Harnessing the power of data and becoming a professional in the field of data science, Ivan is currently pursuing a M.S. degree in Business Analytics at UCLA Anderson School of Management.

His primary focus is to derive insights from data and transform them into strategic assets for companies that point to long term growth.

Ivan’s experiences with international projects helped companies diversify their geographic reach across the globe by developing localization strategies that are in alignment with regional nuances. He has studied, lived, and worked in three different cultures (U.S., UAE, and China), which prepared him well for working with people from diverse backgrounds and of all ages. Ivan also possesses strong interpersonal skills and is an active team player.

His specialities include:

✯ Programming Languages: Python (pandas, numpy), SQL (join & window functions), R (dplyr, tidyverse), LaTex

✯ Analytical Tools & Software: STATA, Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets

✯ Data Visualization: ggplot, ggplot2, Cytoscape, matplotlib

✯ Data Modeling: Network Analysis, Linear Regression, Random Walk

Aside from his work, Ivan is an avid golfer with 6 years of experience!

Jiacen graduated from Purdue University in 2022 with double majors in Applied Statistics and Industrial Management/Data Analytics, and a certificate in Applications in Data Science. In an effort to explore the real-world application of statistics and data analytics, Jiacen interned as a data analyst at an American supercenter chain throughout the Midwest, which gave her an eye-opening exposure to the data-driven supply chain management (SCM) and operations research (OR), a socially impactful business area where cutting-edge statistical theory, mathematical optimization algorithms, and data analytics tools are combined to help forecast market trends, plan for inventory, land on optimal strategies, increase profit line, and ensure visibility across all the market channels.

Academically, Jiacen considers herself in possession of three defining traits, i.e. perseverance, critical thinking, and curiosity, allowing her to garner an exemplary GPA and several prestigious scholarships. As for her quantitative background, Jiacen’s knowledge in mathematics spans mathematical analysis (multivariable calculus, differential equations) and stochastic mathematics (probability, inferential/descriptive statistics, time series analysis, stochastic processes), with their applications for modeling dynamics processes, driving mathematical optimization, guiding algorithm design, enabling statistical learning, and quantifying uncertainty. As for programming skill, Jiacen is a proficient user of mainstream languages including Java, MATLAB, Python, the statistical computing languages such as R and SPSS, and the database language such as MySQL. Driven by her great passion in data analytics, Jiacen gained familiarity with various libraries in Python for data wrangling (NumPy, SciPy and Pandas), machine learning (Scikit-Learn and TensorFlow), data mining (Scrapy), data visualization (Matplotlib and Seaborn), and automated testing (Selenium). Also, she developed a decent proficiency in using relational SQL database, distributed database (Hadoop), and the associated engine for large-scale data processing (Spark).

Jiacen understands that the success of the data analyst profession hinges on effective stakeholder collaboration. Going forward, Jiacen is looking forward to further study at UCLA Anderson School of Management how to communicate effectively with customer partners with limited technical background, how to collaborate with internal technology partners to design, deliver, test, support, deploy, and support the product, and how to convince business partners who authorize, champion and support the product based on well-prepared presentations and rigorously established rationales.

Upon graduation from UCLA, Jiacen aspire to join a IT & networking/retailing/manufacturing company, where she can leverage her advanced data analytics and deep understanding of SCM to gather, interpret and deliver the insights to the business decision makers, allowing them to optimize resource allocation, and build an intricately balanced set of innovative capabilities across various business developments. Facing increasing competition, regulatory constraints and customer needs, the manufacturing industry nowadays is seeking new ways to leverage technology to gain efficiency. Correspondingly, there exist numerous challenges such as the collection of unstructured data differing greatly in volume, variety and velocity, the biased statistical analysis leading to misleading conclusions, and the lack of long-term predictive capability. Those are among the key areas Jiacen hopes to work on going forward.

Lydia Jin obtained her degree in Business Administration with minors in psychology and media design from Carnegie Mellon University with honors in 2018. Through her interdisciplinary studies at CMU, Lydia saw the interconnectedness between various fields and how data analytics is the ubiquitous foundation of driving successful strategic decisions. Driven by her passion in business analytics, she joined Deloitte upon graduation and worked there for 3 years as a Senior Consultant. Lydia served a multitude of cross industry clients including TMT, consumer goods, financial, and healthcare companies She supported these companies in services-led transformation, data visualization and metrics reporting, agile transformation, operations remodeling, and technology risk related projects. She gained hands on experience using SQL, Microsoft Excel VBA, and Alteryx on her projects. Additionally, Lydia worked as a Solutions Engineer at CaptivateIQ, a commission automation SaaS startup where she built in-house custom product models and presented demos for prospective clients which led to numerous sales. Lydia also worked on ad hoc projects with the product and design teams to design and push new product features.

Lydia is a firm believer and practitioner in building the bridge between business and technology. With a strong passion in becoming an advanced data analytics professional, she is currently pursuing a MS in Business Analytics degree at The University of California Los Angeles Anderson School of Business. She is strengthening her skills in integrating knowledge from the three pillars of statistics, business, and programming and looks forward to creating more business value in the future with the use of data.

Jiaqi graduated summa cum laude from the University of California, Los Angeles in 2022 with a bachelor’s degree in Mathematics/Economics, specialized in Computing. Her deep interest towards data science and analytics led her to pursue her master’s degree in Business Analytics at UCLA Anderson. She sees herself as an active thinker, a quick learner, and a creative problem-solver that is in nature intrigued by questions and is eager to take on new challenges.

During her undergraduate studies, Jiaqi developed a solid foundation in mathematics, statistics, and programming. Jiaqi conducted several data analytics and machine learning projects in which she built complex classification and prediction models, conducted temporal network analysis on 300K rows of data, and created a web app for user interaction. She also developed knowledge in algorithm, optimization, data structure, and other programming related subjects in pursuit of her degree specialization.

In the professional realm, Jiaqi worked as a Business Analytics Intern on the Product-Led-Growth team at Trimble during summer 2022, where she used her knowledge in SQL, Excel, and various visualization tools to automate core data processing workflows that were done manually in the past, improving the team’s work efficiency by 80%. She also analyzed and compared product marketing performance across Trimble construction softwares, and created data dashboards and reports to deliver actionable insights for future improvements. Jiaqi is looking forward to further honing her skills in analytics during her time at Anderson, and she can’t wait to contribute her unique insights and values to the world of data upon graduation.

Jiarui graduated from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in May 2022 with bachelor’s degrees in Finance and Accounting. During her time at UIUC, she developed an entrepreneurial mindset and a deep understanding of the financial market, which assisted her toward reaching her goal of making an immediate significant impact as a business analyst within a dynamic environment. Both of her internships at investing and financing departments in China have prepared her to process financial data in the IPO process and conduct constructive research of multiple industries. Meanwhile, the investment stimulation project further developed her technical analysis skills, which also inspired her in business analytics for her master’s studies.

Jiarui joined the Master of Science in Business Analytics (MSBA) program at UCLA Anderson in 2022, with a strong passion for expanding her knowledge in data science and business domain. Through her coursework, Jiarui improved her proficiency in programming languages such as Python, SQL and R, and analysis skills for academic and industrial applications such as prescriptive models and business optimization.

She looks forward to leveraging her past professional experience and the skills gained from the study at MSBA program at UCLA to make her adapt to the role of a business analyst in the near future.

Jenny pursued her Bachelor in Commerce with a Marketing concentration at the University of British Columbia and her first Master's in Strategic Communication with a focus on digital media at Columbia University. Her experiences as a marketing analyst and digital media specialist in a luxury furniture retailer, eCommerce startup, airline, and FinTech have confirmed her career passion in the marketing field.

Jenny joined the Master of Science in Business Analytics (MSBA) program at UCLA Anderson in 2022 with a strong passion for combining her marketing passion and expertise with advanced analytical skills. Prior to joining UCLA MSBA, she had over two years of work experience in which she witnessed that all marketing decisions are made based on data and thorough analytics. Marketing analytics coupled with widely-available data from eCommerce and digital media platforms empower modern marketers to make more informed decisions. Reflecting on her current toolkit, she would like to sharpen her analytical and technical skills to integrate advanced analytical tools into the marketing decision-making process. Career inspiration and industry trends are two key reasons she wants to pursue a career in business analytics after graduation.

She is also confident of her success in the field because she has demonstrated solid analytical skills throughout her previous experiences. Given the opportunity, she will be able to unleash her career potential by positioning herself as a unique talent with advanced marketing experience, expertise, and analytical capability.

Jiaxin graduated from UCLA in 2022 with a Bachelor’s degree in Applied Mathematics. During her undergraduate studies, she accumulated knowledge in math, statistics, and computer science. She has developed interest in data analytics through coursework and projects. She’s passionate about translating data into actionable insights.

Currently, she is a Master of Science in Business Analytics student at UCLA Anderson School of Management. She has enjoyed learning about statistical modeling, machine learning, and optimization courses. She implemented her analytics and visualization skills to distill insights from data for clients in industries including automation & sustainability, e-commerce, and education.

She aims to achieve effective data storytelling that addresses the needs of intended audience and to synthesize findings for recipients to leverage insights for intelligent decision-making. She looks forward to using the data analytics and machine learning knowledge she has learned in MSBA in her future job.

Zelia is now a MS in Business Analytics student at UCLA Anderson, and she graduated from the University of California, Berkeley in Fall 2021 with a B.A. in Statistics. She has been top in her major during her undergrad studies and was invited to Phi Beta Kappa, Alpha of California (Academic Honor Society). Jiaying is passionate about integrating data analytics into business decisions and bridging the communication gap by presenting complex problems to different clients in the simplest ways. She aims to be a person who understands the deep logic of Statistics/Mathematics models with professional programming skills and great problem-solving capability.

Prior to MSBA, Jiaying was an intern at HITACHI, she learned to integrate data analytics into business decisions. She was tasked with optimizing code (Python) to implement high first-pass yield (FPY) and supply-side transitions and analyzed historical data (SQL & Tableau) with algorithm methods to find greater efficiencies. During this internship, she was introduced to full automation barriers in the East Asian business environment. The obstacles included scalability, lack of human resources, and high cost of automation. During her undergrad studies, she advanced her technical knowledge through tons of academic and Kaggle projects(Python, Machine Learning, Time Series Analysis) in different fields.

It’s her honor to join the UCLA MSBA family. In her business endeavors and internships, these realizations became the main driving force for applying to business analytics graduate programs and pursuing a career centered around analytics. Though she has been able to feel relatively comfortable with coding, having taken two boot camps in the past six months to create the necessary programs to actualize her vision, she lacks the business experience and acumen to connect business and data analytics properly. UCLA's Business Analytics graduate program helps her to bridge this gap together.

Jieke Liu received his bachelor’s degree in Risk Management and Insurance from Peking University in 2022. Back in his undergraduate years, Jieke interned in several different industries, including finance, management consulting, commercial banking and internet. In this exploration process, the internship experience as a data analyst at a commercial bank helped cultivate both his technical skills and his communication skills in the process of building and implementing prediction models. That experience, as well as the Quantitative Marketing Models course that he took in his junior year motivated his passion for applying data analytics to business context. As a gamer and e-sports fan himself, Jieke had great passion for the gaming industry and LA provided some of the best gaming companies in the world. The above factors together led to his decision to join the Master of Science in Business Analytics program at UCLA Anderson School of Management, and started his career in the analytics field.

Jieke has learned a lot from the MSBA program. On the technical side, his SQL, python and R skills are greatly improved through coursework as well as competitions. Jieke participated in three analytics competitions- Adobe Analytics Challenge, Humana Mays Healthcare Analytics Case Competition and Amazon Hackathon, from which he gained much data science experiences and practiced using his analytics skills in real-life data. On the soft skill side, the program provided many team work opportunities, where he collaborated with classmates from very diverse background. This greatly strengthen his communication skills by translating technical terms into plain words and effectively presenting them to teammates. Such experience helped him prepare for future cross-functional collaboration in workspace.

Justin is a native Californian who graduated from the University of San Diego in 2018 with a Bachelor’s in Finance. Following graduation, Justin remained in San Diego as part of Wells Fargo’s Commercial Banking division, where he held a variety of roles specializing in financial data analysis, portfolio management, and client management of middle market companies with revenues ranging from $20M to $2B. These roles allowed him to work cross-functionally with his analysis and sales teams to guarantee deal continuity and develop strong relationships with his clients. During his time at Wells Fargo, he found himself becoming increasingly interested in quantitative business analysis and the strategic decision-making process that follows.

After nearly four years of financial analytics and management experience in banking, Justin is now excited to pursue a deliberate career pivot into business analytics. Justin joined the Business Analytics program at Anderson to round out his business acumen and hone his analytics skills in an interdisciplinary setting. Leveraging his finance background, Justin is looking forward to blending his business experience with the skills learned in the MSBA program to help spearhead data-driven enterprise decisions. He has found his database management courses especially exciting and looks forward to applying this knowledge in a business analyst role in the future.

Beyond the classrooms and offices, Justin is an avid golfer, snowboarder, hiker, and traveler. If he’s not on the links, at the beach, or in the mountains, you’ll find him watching whatever big game is on (Go Bruins!). He also offers his time as an executive advisor for a student organization he was previously a leadership member of at the University of San Diego. There, he utilizes his knowledge and experiences to lend a helping hand to those in a similar position as he once was, with the goal of improving their efficiency and maximizing their campus impact. This commitment as a former student leader has pushed Justin to remain involved as an active student leader, serving as a Director of UCLA Anderson’s SBA (Sports Business Association).

Justin is honored to be part of the 2023 MSBA cohort and is continuously impressed by the knowledge and achievements of his diverse classmates and Anderson faculty alike.

Karthik completed his bachelor's in Materials Science from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Bombay. He was taken captive by Data Analytics during his sophomore year. To add a hands-on facet to my learning, he participated in hackathons to hone his data analytics skills and make himself competent enough to take on more considerable challenges. His project on HR Appraisal Analytics opened up a completely different world to my imagination. Additionally, his internship with MITACS, which entailed materials and analytics, motivated him to believe that data paves a deterministic way in any field. In a way, these experiences reinforced his belief that Data is the new currency.

After witnessing the power of data, he chose to work as a Business Analyst at Axis Bank. His work majorly involved providing data-driven solutions to improve the commercial lending business. He drove acquisition campaigns that enhanced our book by $20M. He also developed segmentation models and performed A/B testing to assist the sales executives in effectively managing their portfolios.

He joined UCLA's MSBA program to gain the best possible amalgam of business skills and data analytics. He aims to develop hyper-personalized strategies to propel synergetic relations between consumers and businesses. From volunteering to ensure the health and hygiene of campus workers to conducting awareness and donation drives, he believes in bringing positive change in society. In addition to his professional pursuits, he hopes to empower disadvantaged students with his knowledge and prowess.

In his free time, he finds solace around music, spending time with friends and family, and watching cricket.

Khang has four years of experience working in both public and private sectors. Currently, he is pursuing a Master of Science in Business Analytics at UCLA Anderson School of Management, with an Anderson Merit Fellowship. With a passion for data management, he aspired to become a Data Engineer who develops effective data solutions for organizations.

His journey into the data space began with his experience as a Research Analyst at Third Bridge, where he worked closely with many consulting clients such as BCG, Bain, L.E.K, and PwC, to deliver primary research reports with industry insights. He used tools such as MS Excel and PowerBI to develop dashboards and support his analysis. At Avery Dennison, as an Account Manager and Sales Analyst, he used Qliksense and MS Excel extensively to analyze sales data, make reports, forecast sales and present data with visualizations. Khang also has completed two boot camps on Python and Machine Learning (conferred by FPT Software) and Data Engineer Professional Certificate (offered by IBM and Coursera), from which he obtains solid knowledge of data engineering.

In the MSBA program at UCLA Anderson with a strong focus in analytics, he practices solving business problems with SQL, R and Python featured prominently. Khang has found his Database Management course especially exciting and can’t wait to apply his knowledge in a Data Engineering role upon graduation.

Outside of studying and working, Khang is actively into running, hiking and volunteering. He also loves learning new languages.

Kun graduated from Boston University in 2021 with a B.S. degree in Mathematics with a concentration in Statistics. During her undergraduate program, Kun took programming and math courses which gives her a solid technical background. Kun discovered her passion in working with data and drawing useful conclusions from data analysis through group and individual projects including time series, stochastic methods and linear modeling.

After completing her degree, Kun interned in a startup company called Shepherd Ventures which focused on making business decisions using data analysis during market meltdowns. As a quantitative analyst, Kun’s job included performing weekly web scraping, developing mathematical models to predict market behaviors, and making business decisions in a business setting.

This one-year internship experience helped Kun determine to pursue a degree in MSBA in UCLA in order to acquire more analytics and business knowledge. She is particularly excited about the Prescriptive Modeling, Database Management, and Optimization courses. Kun is looking forward to applying these analytical skills to solve real world problems and making better data-driven decisions.

Leo graduated from the University of Michigan with a Bachelor’s degree in Statistics & Data Science, and a double minor in Business and Entrepreneurship. He strives to combine his business acumen and data expertise to empower better decisions and drive business value. Leo has worked as a business analyst intern and data science intern across various industries at companies like Wayfair and Huawei Technologies, and his projects range from sales forecasting and outlier detection to speech analytics, supply chain optimization, and sports analytics. Leo’s passion for business analytics is rooted in his fondness for data and his belief in its potential.

Leo joined MSBA because of its exceptional balance of academia and career focus. He believes that successful data experts require more than a solid foundation in statistics and analytics, they are entrepreneurs, problem solvers, and critical thinkers. Furthermore, they need to have communication skills, presentation proficiency, and a solid understanding of business. Leo believes that the MSBA program at UCLA can foster such talents, and he is beyond excited to join the class of 2022.

Besides playing with data, Leo also loves to travel and play basketball. He is probably the biggest Washington Wizards fan you will find. Outside of school and work, you can either catch him at the John Wooden Center or Terminal 7 of LAX airport.

Linglong Zhuo graduated from the University of California, San Diego with a bachelor's degree in Applied Mathematics and a minor in Business. During her undergraduate studies, she developed a solid theoretical foundation in quantitative disciplines such as linear algebra, time series and stochastic processes, and optimal resource allocation. She also garnered knowledge in finance, global venture strategy, product promotion, and brand management.

After graduation, Linglong worked as an e-commerce specialist for a wholesale cabinet hardware company where she was delegated to help the company transition from a brick-and-mortar store to various online platforms. With Python, she built a framework to analyze user experience metrics and leveraged it to redesign the entire site in conjunction with SEO techniques. In addition, she updated product listings and used R to analyze collected online sales data in which she identified areas of loss across product lines and proposed solutions to senior management to optimize price quotes and ensure the company maintains a healthy profit margin. She believes that business analytics helps achieve micro-targeting and personalized communications that facilitate an emotional connection between the customer and the company's brand values, which is critical in addressing today's fast-paced, mobile-oriented consumer mentality. The power of business analytics skills in alleviating the challenges associated with data and content management, as well as empowering companies to gain a holistic perspective in aligning strategies and reaching performance goals, make it an attractive career for her.

The MSBA program at UCLA Anderson has helped Linglong sharpen both her conceptual and practical understanding of analytic frameworks, optimization methods, prescriptive and predictive modeling, and machine learning. These hard skills allow her to assist organizations in making data-driven decisions and providing actionable insights that could boost organizations' performance. The program also equipped her with strong soft skills, such as communication skills, that are essential to mitigating gaps in understanding between different teams and communicating effectively with stakeholders. Linglong is excited to join the MSBA 2023 cohort and looks forward to applying her technical and business skills in analyzing industry trends and delivering companies' standalone value efficiently and cost-effectively.

Martin graduated as an Industrial Engineer with specialization in Information Technologies from Universidad Católica de Chile in 2014. Working as the COO for a startup on 2014, he developed a strong interest in problem solving and using the data and analytics to help companies to make better strategic decisions. After that, he worked as a Management Control Analyst in an international hospitality company. In two year, working with the data-warehouse, business intelligence, and leading important projects, he was promoted to the head of the department, having in charge a team responsible for the development of business intelligence. The company was acquired by Accor, where Martin participated as one of the leaders in the due diligence, the posterior integration of processes and systems between both companies and was in charge of the reporting of more than 200 hotels in South America.

The last working challenge was in other international hospitality company, Tanica Hoteles, where he was hired to make some big changes in how the company was managing the hotels and develop the Business Intelligence department. On those two years, using his strong analytical and technical skills, teamwork and business knowledge, Martin was able to change some core systems, pipelining and start using the data to create a data-warehouse, feeding different core processes and reports all across the company. This led to a modernization of the company, on how processes from the operation to general management started to be based on using the reporting, automating processes and changing the culture of the company to be more analytically driven.

His desire to always be learning new technologies, is what pushed him to be pursuing a MS in Business Analytics at UCLA Anderson, allowing him to learn from the best experts how to use data find insights that can be transformed into strategic actions.

Melvyn Wang graduated from The University of Texas at Austin on May 2019 with a degree in Petroleum Engineering and a certificate in Business Foundations. During Melvyn’s undergraduate degree, he first became attracted to data-driven analysis from his student research position. This was his first exposure to high level data analysis in an industry where data was not highly explored. During his time in this position, he was able to work closely with developing a NOSQL database for the data provided by multiple oil and gas companies. Furthermore, Melvyn performed profound data analysis through MATLAB that helped reduce the companies’ operation costs by 5%. Evidently, Melvyn saw the importance of data driven decisions for businesses and decided to apply these skills through his professional career.

After graduation, Melvyn became an Optimization Engineer at ChampionX, one of the largest oil and gas service companies in the industry. At ChampionX, Melvyn learned to make quick and effective decisions while performing data analysis in order to keep the clients satisfied and their equipment producing for as long as possible. Melvyn was also able to continue developing his leadership, communication, and technical skills as he interacted with clients daily and led client meetings to explore ways of improving production through thorough analysis of past data. Driven by his passion to generate business impact using data, he is now currently pursuing a Master’s in Business Analytics at UCLA to further develop his analytical and technical skills.

Melvyn is excited to be a part of the MSBA class of 2023. He is especially excited to indulge in the Competitive Analytics and Entertainment Analytics coursework. Melvyn is looking forward to gaining the business acumen and improving his analytical practice throughout the program. Ultimately, Melvyn is excited to combine all his experiences to make an impact on his future data analytics team and business.

Michelle graduated from UCLA with a BS in Financial Mathematics and a BA in Communications. Her interest in data analytics started in her senior year, where she developed and carried out a year-long research project as part of UCLA’s highly selective honors program. Michelle was awarded the Undergraduate Research Fellows Program Scholarship for her research in identifying the presence and strength of correlations between various demographic factors and knowledge levels on women’s healthcare.

Upon graduating, Michelle spent the following four years working as a data analyst at a marketing startup. During her tenure, she developed an automated KPI reporting system using R that improved productivity and helped implement an SQL database that translated business needs into actionable insights. She performed various analyses which included time series modeling for projections and KNN models for CPA optimizations. Michelle is also proficient at data visualization and enjoys utilizing data trends to build case studies and business decks to provide support for strategy recommendations.

Michelle is currently enrolled in the MSBA program at UCLA Anderson School of Management to gain business acumen and round out her analytics training in a truly interdisciplinary setting. She is particularly interested in competitive analytics, product analytics, and machine learning. Michelle is passionate about analytics and believes in its ability to optimize businesses using data-driven decisions. She wants to use this program to leverage data for strategic decision-making and use storytelling to engage and persuade audiences on the importance of data insights.

In 2019, Miranda graduated with a B.A. in International Business and a minor in Accounting from University of California, San Diego. In her time at UCSD, she built a solid business foundation with coursework in organizational leadership, finance, marketing, business strategy, and advanced accounting topics. She also paddled on the UCSD Dragon Boat team for four years, serving as a board member for two years as the Fundraising/PR Chair and Social Chair.

Upon graduation, Miranda joined KPMG’s Silicon Valley office in the Corporate Tax department. Throughout her time with the firm, she developed her analytical, leadership, and project management skills. As an Associate, she cleaned and analyzed financial data for cybersecurity, retail, and tech companies, building tax models for compliance and financial reporting purposes. After her promotion to a Senior Associate, she also managed project workflows and mentored associates and interns to develop strong team members on top of technical work. Additionally, Miranda earned her Certified Public Accountant (CPA) license in December of 2020 after successfully passing all four parts of the exam and gaining a full year of work experience.

In the M.S Business Analytics program at UCLA Anderson School of Management, Miranda has found problem solving using SQL and Python to be particularly satisfying. She is excited to develop further knowledge on internet and customer analytics and leverage her new skills to future roles where she can help effectively drive business decisions based on insights extracted from data.

Nicholas is a student in the M.S. Business Analytics program at the UCLA Anderson School of Management. Beginning his studies as an undergraduate at Boston College’s Carroll School of Management, he learned a mix of business and technical skills. Post-graduation, he refined and expounded on these skills working as a consultant and as a data analyst.

Upon graduating from Boston College, Nicholas worked for two years as a consultant in Boston, MA. Working mainly at multinational banks, Nicholas learned SQL and combined his quantitative skills and business acumen to improve bank-wide data quality. Enjoying the opportunities available with SQL, he moved to a Data Analyst position at a healthcare analytics company where he provided diverse clients with actionable and customizable reports. Wanting to continue his education, Nicholas applied to Anderson’s Business Analytics program.

In the MSBA program, Nicholas is improving his SQL skills, developing machine learning expertise in python, and applying advanced statistical concepts in R for analytics. He is grateful to be learning from world class faculty along with exceptional peers.

Nicholas is excited to apply the knowledge he has acquired in the program to future internships and full-time roles. His areas of preference are data science and data analytics but is open to experience any data related roles.

Nihong worked as a Product Manager at China Foreign Exchange Trade System, the interbank trading division of China’s Central Bank, for nearly four years. She led multiple Proof-of-Concept projects to boost FinTech innovation, such as recommendation system and synthetic data. She also managed the implementation of Data-related Information Systems, helping integrate new products with existing eco-system and streamline the customer journey. Through this experience, she learned how to leverage analytics and cutting-edge technical tools to satisfy clients’ business needs and reduce operation cost. Prior to working at China Foreign Exchange Trade System, Nihong graduated with a master’s degree in Business Administration with honors from Peking University. She also completed her undergraduate studies at Peking University, majoring in Accounting.

Currently, Nihong is a Master of Science in Business Analytics student at UCLA Anderson School of Management, with an Anderson Merit Fellowship. She joined this program to further develop her skills in data analytics by growing her comfort with different programming languages and learning more about utilizing the technique to solve business problems. She is excited to focus on topics such as machine learning, customer analytics, and data management. She can’t wait to apply her knowledge into empowering wider communities upon graduation.

In her free time, Nihong enjoys Sci-Fi movies, Rock music, and playing Animal Crossing. She also actively participates in strength exercises, hoping to get strong with her fellow Bruins.

Pallav graduated from BITS-Pilani, a tier 1 University in India, in the year 2016 with a degree in B.E.(Hons.) Civil Engineering. Pallav developed a passion for Analytics towards the final years of his undergraduate education. He completed a few courses on Coursera to augment his skills and was able to crack one of the toughest job interviews at ZS Associates and was, thus, able to land a job there.

At ZS Associates, Pallav underwent a training in Patient Level Data (PLD), one of the most important and nuanced datasets in the Pharma domain, and he applied those concepts to his next job at Tredence Analytics to solve problems ranging from evaluating performance metrics of a drug to optimizing the sales of a drug.

Majority of the Pallav’s work experience is in Payment Processing industry as he worked at PayPal for about 4 years. At PayPal, he solved challenging business problems and his recommendations led to consistent multi-million-dollar loss savings and revenue gains. He was instrumental in building the “Incentive Abuse” portfolio at PayPal that aimed to save marketing campaigns from incentive abuse.

Pallav is currently augmenting his skills in Optimization, Machine Learning, AB Testing, through the program of MS in Business Analytics at University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA).

Peilin He is a result-oriented problem solver and an excellent team player with concrete knowledge of data science and extensive analytics experience.

She graduated with distinction from the University of Virginia, McIntire School of Commerce with a Bachelor of Science degree in Commerce, with concentrations in Finance and Marketing. During college, Peilin developed a solid foundation in quantitative analysis with Excel, Python, and R, gained hands-on experience analyzing raw data under different business contexts, and honed her skills in communicating compelling stories based on data-driven insights to C-suite audiences.

Upon graduation, equipped with skillsets in processing and analyzing massive financial data, Peilin joined KPMG LLP in New York City in its Economics and Valuations Service Group. During her three years at KPMG, Peilin performed a series of data-oriented financial modeling for M&A transactions and led teams of associates to solve real-world problems that consistently led to multi-million-dollar revenue generation. She also spearheaded the initiative to incorporate data from post-M&A financial disclosures to build a robust framework that validated internally computed modeling assumptions.

Currently, Peilin is pursuing a Master of Science in Business Analytics degree at UCLA Anderson School of Management, with aspirations of applying technical skills from rigorous training offered at the program and business acumen accumulated from industry experiences towards data science/product analytics roles in the Technology/Entertainment/Consumer Retail industries during the summer of 2023 and upon graduation.

Rateeb has three years of experience working in data analytics and machine learning projects for a startup he launched in 2019. Back then, Rateeb started 01tutor, a company that designs and sells online courses tailored to undergraduate students in target universities in the Middle East and Canada. Rateeb has operated the company for three years as a Chief Executive Officer, where he led a team of marketers, lawyers, instructors, and developers to drive his business forward. He leveraged data analytics to come up with data driven solutions to enter new markets, grow revenue streams, maintain customer loyalty, and improve operational efficiency. Currently, he is pursuing his Master of Science in Business Analytics at UCLA Anderson School of Management.

Apart from creating and maintaining structural databases for his business, Rateeb has built and evaluated machine learning models to solve problems about Natural Language Processing, Operational Analytics, and Customer Analytics. He has also conducted simulation analysis to study short and long term effects of inflation, costs, revenues, and MARR on his business. This has led to critical decisions that grew the business and alleviated macroeconomic problems.

During his undergraduate studies at the American University of Beirut, Rateeb was interested in discovering the distribution of prime numbers. He worked closely with his undergraduate Mathematics professor to analyze a dataset of one million prime numbers. He leveraged Python to analyze, visualize and build models from available data. As a result of his research, Rateeb proposed two prime conjectures and was able to build a Random Forest Classifier for predicting primes with a 100% precision.

Rateeb has also conducted a lot of independent projects on the side, which enhanced his hands-on experience with large datasets and machine learning applications. He built and evaluated machine learning models to predict spam emails, classify images of cats and dogs, predict probability of admissions to a graduate school, cluster customers of a bank, and build recommendation engines (both collaborative and content based).

Rateeb is developing a lot of technical skills at UCLA Anderson. He has found his Machine Learning courses very interesting and can’t wait to build on his knowledge and apply his skills in a data analyst role upon graduation.

‘Without data, we are just another person with an opinion’ is an excellent quote by Edward Deming. Keeping this in high regard, Rohan appreciates the potential of analytics across the Fin-tech industry. His curiosity about data analytics as a problem-solving tool started growing during the time spent at his alma mater IIT Kharagpur. He worked as a research assistant at NCTU Taiwan and did remote projects with the University of Halifax, Canada during his Undergraduate studies.

He was a campus hire for EXL Analytics and worked for a US banking giant for 4 years, covering the areas like Credit Risk, First Party Fraud, and Comprehensive Capital Analysis & Review (CCAR). His area of expertise lies in formulating strategies for revenue increment, loss mitigation, and customer experience enhancement encapsulating the concepts of Credit Abuse.
