Apart from being skilled in SAS/SQL, Python, and data visualization tools, Rohan has a great business understanding of this industry and was highly active in project engagements with senior leadership and management. He implemented 5 credit change initiatives leading to $7M in benefits. Within the CCAR project, Rohan led the work of the Business Risk Team, managing the Federal deadlines, cross-functional work, and the stakeholders from 6 different verticals inside the organization. He was responsible for his projects from conception to post-implementation at EXL Analytics.

Apart from work, Rohan is a skilled Tabla (Indian Classical Instrument) player. He also enjoys playing Basketball in his leisure time. He is looking forward to working on impactful Analytics projects in Fin-tech and creating more impact for customers by leveraging the learnings from the MSBA Program at UCLA.

Rohan is an Analytics Professional with 3+ years of consulting experience in healthcare, energy, and research.

He graduated in Mechanical Engineering from IIT Dhanbad. After a brief period of working as a research assistant at the Multiphase flow lab at IIT Mandi, Rohan joined a consulting company as a safety consultant where he assessed risk of core damage of a European nuclear power plant in case of a fire accident.

In his next job at ZS Associates, Rohan worked on designing and executing several growth marketing projects involving customer insights and market research to generate data-driven insights for Fortune 500 pharmaceutical companies. His efforts were consistently appreciated by his team, and he was promoted to the role of Associate Consultant in less than 2 years with the company.

Rohan is keen to learn and use advanced techniques like ML and big data to solve business problems. UCLA’s MSBA has already started paying dividends as he has worked on a couple of ML projects and strengthened his understanding of Statistics. He looks forward to exploring challenges faced by different industries and solving them using advanced analytics.

In his free time, Rohan enjoys playing chess and reading fiction.

Rohith completed his Bachelor’s in Mechanical Engineering from the National Institute of Technology (NIT), Calicut in India. He was first exposed to business within the field of engineering and technology when he took up the courses, Management of Production Systems, Quality Planning and Analysis, and Supply Chain Management, in his Bachelor’s degree. These areas rekindled his passion for finding solutions to challenging problems, thus drawing him towards the analytical side of the business field.

In addition, the practical sessions on the statistical programming languages like R and Python Programming, helped him to realize how data can be perceived and analyzed. Moreover, online courses in the areas of Data Science, R, and Python programming, further illuminated him about various disciplines within this field. Displaying sound knowledge in Analytics and Programming, got him recruited as an Associate IT Consultant, at ITC Infotech India Limited. Here, he further demonstrated his programming skills in C, C# and ReactJS Library, through different projects.

He was able to join the UCLA Anderson School’s MSBA program which enabled him to expand his knowledge in his areas of interest such as Machine Learning, Data Visualization, Statistical Mathematics, R, Python and SQL for Data Science, Customer Analytics and other courses on Business Administration. He wishes to learn to integrate and apply these knowledge and skills of Business Analytics to create better business value and to give back to his society.

Apart from academics, he has always been keen to work for underrepresented groups throughout his education. He wishes and strives to be a part of the diverse and inclusive community that the Anderson School is and hopes to carry forward the spirit of diversity, equity, and inclusion to my professional life.

Ruiqi Chen graduated from the University of Michigan in 2022 with a Bachelor's degree in Statistics & Economics and a minor in Entrepreneurship. During her undergraduate years, she worked as a research assistant at Automotive Futures to study industrial movements of the New Energy Vehicles market. Driven by her strong interest in business and data science, she incorporated her analytical acquaintances and skills to tackle real-world problems through internships at Bank of America Merrill Lynch as a credit risk analyst and a product analyst at American Express.

Her interest in business analytics is built upon her sensitivity to numbers, business intuition, as well as her belief in the potential of data. She has comprehended the ability to utilize the power of data analytics tools to influence business decisions. This also motivates her to pursue her MS in Business Analytics at UCLA Anderson.

She is innovative, collaborative, and communicative, as well as a leader and problem-solver. Product management and business analytics in the technology field are at the intersection of her passion and skill sets, as well as a tremendous and growing industry demand.

Sean is a collaborative, data-driven problem solver passionate about leveraging the capabilities of new technologies to drive business value.

After completing his undergraduate coursework a semester early, Sean graduated from Fordham University with a degree in Economics and Computer Science. While at Fordham, Sean was also a student-athlete on the Division 1 varsity football team. Along with his student-athlete obligations Sean was active in the New York community, serving as the Community Service Coordinator for Fordham’s Student Athlete Advisory Committee in the Bronx.

Sean’s experience in New York consisted of excelling in technical courses while developing prominent interpersonal communication skills. While leading teams of peers in and out of the classroom, he identified a passion for the intersection of data-driven decision making and project management. He is most attracted to the ability analytics has to improve the decision making process, and blending that with efficient leadership. During his final year of undergraduate studies, Sean identified he wanted to further hone his analytical skills through graduate-level studies. Promptly after Fordham graduation, Sean was accepted into the MSBA program at UCLA.

Sean has experience working with impactful organizations, such as New York Supreme Court Justice Robert Holdman. Under Judge Holdmans mentorship, Sean refined both his curiosity and determination as he was in an environment with elite decision makers and professionals.

His undergraduate studies paired with his internship and off-campus experiences allowed him to see the connection between data science concepts and practical applications in the business world. This intersection of technical insights and business acumen is what drove him to strengthen his technical skills at UCLA Anderson.

Sean is excited to broaden his technical capabilities through his courseload in the MSBA program, as well as learn from his network of classmates and program alumni. Sean recently joined UCLA Anderson’s Strategy and Operations Management Association (SOMA), and is excited to continue to grow his network at Anderson.

In tandem with his studies, Sean is continuing his athletic career here at UCLA as a member of the Division 1 varsity football team. He is the first varsity athlete to be in UCLA Anderson’s MSBA program.

Sean is particularly interested in his Machine Learning and Database Management courses as he sees them blending technical skills with business application. He is excited to put the expertise he has amassed through coursework to use in product management, strategy operations, and other roles in similar fields.

One of Shangran Gao’s greatest accomplishments in life is that she only spent two and half years completing her undergraduate major in Business Management and a minor in Technological Systems Management at Stony Brook University. She has benefited greatly from this intensive studying of Business Management and saved time so that she could pursue graduate study and get an edge along her career journey. In order to explore the practical application of data analysis, Shangran interned at HSBC as Assistant Relationship Manager to prepare financial and cost analysis and profit evaluation reports to reduce fraud by 35% and loosened the guidelines to attract more customers. She also gained experience by participating in data analytics projects and competitions such as Adobe Analytics Challenge, Amazon Hackathon, and MediaData Analytics Project. She worked with a Chinese media company and used Python to collect data on popular TikTok accounts, identified best practices of account operation after reviewing data from over 20 social media accounts, and created and presented a visualization report using Matplotlib and pandas to show top video categories for successful Tik Tokers.

Passionately throwing herself into the whole process further intensified her in-depth understanding of data analysis, including data collection, data preprocessing, data visualization, and modeling. Shangran decided to join the UCLA Master of Science in Business Analytics program with a Merit Fellowship, she has learned advanced SQL, Python, R, and Machine Learning. Given her goal is to interpret the data into something more meaningful for business decisions making, she yearns for developing critical and innovative thinking to maximize the value of the data.

I am a first-year graduate student at the UCLA MSBA (Master of Business Analytics) program. After receiving my bachelor’s degree in Applied Mathematics and Statistics from the same institution, I see my interest grow in the field of data analytics and product management and I am eager to explore my potential in this ever-changing full of data.

My internship experience at larger institutions, including Genesis E-commerce and Tencent, has provided me with business analytics skills that work for companies of any size, and my education at UCLA has equipped me with essential technical skills as well as business ethics and philosophies.

I am seeking opportunities in businesses that could be more successful with analytics and product management. After graduation, I hope my skills and passion can help me and my company grow in a corporate environment.

Sherry graduated from the University of Southern California with a degree in Accounting and went on to work as a certified public accountant at Ernst & Young for 4 years. During that time, she discovered her interest in data transformation and visualization. This experience also gave her much-needed exposure to a wide variety of industries, including but not limited to entertainment studios, retail consumer products, and real estate.

At UCLA Anderson, Sherry is working to develop her technical skills, from proficiency in many different programming and database languages (Python, R, SQL), to data visualization and dashboarding tools (Excel, Tableau), as well as analytical skills such as machine learning, statistical modeling, and A/B testing. She is eager to embrace this increasingly data-centric world with the skills she has honed and developed at UCLA.

Shubham Gupta graduated from BITS Pilani in 2019 with a Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering and a minor in Finance. He founded himself drawn to analytics from the start of his career and spearheaded analytics initiatives at a consumer tech startup back in India called Zomato. He worked there for three years wearing different hats but essentially bridging the gap between data science and business development.

Shubham is innately curious to discover different psychological patterns of customers which make them interact with internet products. He has solved problems from experimentation to implementation, developing innovations that lead to multi-million dollar cost optimization at scale.

Shubham is beyond excited to be a part of the MSBA program at UCLA because of its unique positioning in academia and industry. It offers invaluable opportunities to break barriers between business and technology in a truly interdisciplinary setting.

Shubham also loves to travel and go on hiking. Apart from that, Shubham is a big foodie and loves to try out new dishes/cuisines.

Siting graduated from Pennsylvania State University in 2022 with two Bachelor’s degrees in Applied Statistics and Finance and a minor in Mathematics. Siting‘s intellectual curiosity toward data analytics originally stemmed from her personal experience. As an active social media user, Siting has always been intrigued by the roaring followers on her social media account. Since then, she started to contemplate the technical principles through which social media foresees people's preferences, makes recommendations, and shapes user behaviors.

Prior to joining the MSBA program at UCLA Anderson, Siting had three analytics internship experiences in the consulting, financial, and tech industries. All these experiences enhanced her various field knowledge and analytical skills. Her passion is to leverage her skillsets to solve complex problems and transform data into business insights and strategies for businesses to help them make better decisions.

After joining the MSBA program, Siting participated in two analytics competitions - Amazon Datathon and Humana Healthcare Analytics Competition - where she demonstrated her strong technical skills and ML techniques. Siting has found the Machine Learning and Prescriptive Models courses exciting and can’t wait to apply this knowledge in a data science or analytics role upon graduation.

Siying graduated from the University of Washington, Seattle in 2022 with a B.A. in Econometrics and Quantitative Economics, along with two minors in business and entrepreneurship. She stands as a candidate with strong business insights and analytics skills. Not only is she is passionate about business acumen and data analytics techniques and statistical models, but she is capable of applying such concepts to solve complex business problems.

As a marketing analyst intern at NielsenIQ, Siying developed her interest in business analytics as she helped clients to analyze monthly sales report. She also identified root causes of the sales fluctuation of products. Following this experience, she joined Accenture as a strategy & consulting intern where she nurtured her consulting mindset and further developed her storytelling skills. These experiences motivated her to seek continued education through UCLA Anderson’s MSBA program to advance her technical skills and business insights.

As an entrepreneur, Siying has had two start-up experiences in the pet industry. She has contributed as marketing manager for Toasty Pets, where she was responsible for analyzing market entry opportunities for the company’s product and analyzed customer behavior to further establish better marketing strategies.

Given her interest in business analytics and product management, she envisions herself working professionally in Tech, Entertainment, and FMCG as a business analyst or product analyst following her graduation from MSBA. She is looking forward to applying analytical techniques learned from the program to help companies make better data-driven decisions.

Sreeroopa, or Roopa, Som is an aspiring technology and operations leader. Her passion for enabling tech transformations in organizations starts with her interest and genuine care in understanding the operations behind a business, and where and how to intervene with insights generated from analyzing historical data. Roopa is known for recommending solutions that prioritize and positively impact stakeholders and for ensuring their successful implementation by rolling up her sleeves to get the job done.

Roopa is a current first-year graduate student at the UCLA Anderson School of Management in the Master of Science of Business Analytics program (MSBA) and a Merit Fellowship recipient. Her favorite courses in the MSBA program are Machine Learning and programming in R because they have helped her solidify her statistics and mathematical computation fundamentals. Prior to UCLA MSBA, Roopa was an Operations Analyst and eventually the Operations Lead, managing work across recruiters, marketers, overseas sourcers, and product developers, at an AI-enabled technical recruiting startup. She also holds a BS degree in Management Science and Engineering and a Minor in Music from Stanford University.

Outside of class, you can probably find Roopa walking her dogs, playing the piano, or learning how to surf.

Srimeghana graduated from GITAM University, India, with a Bachelor of Technology Computer Science and Engineering in June 2022. She's been in various leadership and marketing roles in student clubs throughout her four years of undergrad.

She adores problem-solving and puzzles. It often leads her to want to put pieces together. Doing a fellowship in the non-profit sector showed her how much impact one can create when one decodes the message behind data. So, here she is, pursuing her Master's in Business Analytics at UCLA Anderson School of Management as an Anderson merit fellowship recipient.

She's got experience with Python, SQL, and Data Visualization through internships during her undergrad. She plans on telling stories and solving puzzles by analyzing a business with the correct tools and asking the right questions by combining data and her new skills from the MSBA program.

Sunia is a class of 2023 MSBA student at UCLA Anderson School of Management with a career inspiration to be a versatile leader in disruptive industries to make a tangible business and social impact. Currently, she works as a Finance and Strategy Intern at Axiom Climate, an all-board women's entrepreneurial ClimateTech startup, supporting business strategy and financial analysis through deep-dive due diligence on investment opportunities and compelling data analysis for board members and VC investors.

Before the MSBA program, she worked as a Staff Financial Analyst within the finance department at Allstate with 3 years+ of corporate finance experience, where she oversaw countrywide property product line financial results. She leveraged her expertise not only in analyzing financial results but also in developing compelling storylines that deepen internal client insights and recommend creative actions to drive more profitable market share growth. In addition, she is dedicated to streamlining and redesigning the FP&A process to foster forward-looking capacities. Beyond graduation, she looks forward to developing tangible business solutions for businesses to thrive in the increasingly digitalized world by leveraging the advanced analytics expertise that she acquired in the MSBA program.

Graduated with a BS degree in Mathematics from the Ohio State University in 2019, she has built a strong quantitative foundation, critical thinking ability, innovative problem-solving, and data visualization skills. Out of schoolwork, she was the president of the Math to Industry club of the Math Department at Ohio State University, building liaisons with firms and maintaining alumni relationships for inspiring math students. To continue improving her leadership skills after joining Allstate, she took responsibility for the new analyst onboarding process and served as a peer leader in various projects. Aside from that, she also co-led the Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion council within Allstate's finance department to become an advocate for social equity and led several philanthropy consulting projects at Allstate Foundation.

A passionate Data Scientist who is looking for challenging projects to utilize machine learning and programming to solve complex and ambiguous business problems. My motto is "Don't be a product of your environment, make your environment a product of you".

Currently pursuing a Master of Science in Business Analytics from UCLA Anderson and graduated with an undergraduate degree in engineering and computer science. I love programming, data, and solving complex problems. I have always endeavored to combine these interes
